properties.comment: For Display and Heading
properties.name: fontFamilyHeading

properties.comment: Commonly used for subheaders.
properties.name: fontSizeLarge

properties.comment: The most common and legible font size. Great for large amounts of text, button, links and even subheaders when combined with a bolder weight.
properties.name: fontSizeRegular

properties.comment: Use sparingly. Good for captions, combine with fontWeightBold for legibility.
properties.name: fontSizeTiny

properties.comment: Use sparingly. Display should only be used for yelling at our users.
properties.name: fontSizeDisplay

properties.comment: Use sparingly. Interfaces with multiple header levels could use this in combination with a bold weight.
properties.name: fontSizeXLarge

properties.comment: Commonly used for secondary text. Great for captions, dense areas and in combination with colorTextLight.
properties.name: fontSizeSmall

properties.comment: Commonly used. Most of the time there should only be one header on a page. On iOS the header can scale to 80% to fit the text on one line. Use only with fontWeightHeader.
properties.name: fontSizeHeader

properties.comment: Default weight for display.
properties.name: fontWeightDisplay

properties.comment: Default weight for header.
properties.name: fontWeightHeader

properties.comment: Default weight for tiny, small, regular, large & x-large.
properties.name: fontWeightRegular

properties.comment: Recommended for emphasizing inline text, links, etc.
properties.name: fontWeightSemibold

properties.comment: The maximum level of emphasis
properties.name: fontWeightBold

properties.comment: Regular text on a dark background.
properties.name: colorTextOnDark

properties.comment: Alternative slightly darker background for UI sections.
properties.name: colorBackgroundLight

properties.comment: Primary button background, Link color
properties.name: colorBrand01

properties.comment: Accent color
properties.name: colorBrand02

properties.comment: Light text. Lowest contrast ratio in navy on colorNavy10.
properties.name: colorTextLight

properties.comment: Dark aka inverted background. For footers etc.
properties.name: colorBackgroundDark

properties.comment: Dark section background. Use colorUi00 for text
properties.name: colorUi90

properties.comment: Subtle border for dark background.
properties.name: colorUi80

properties.comment: Plain/basic filled button, subtle border on dark background.
properties.name: colorUi70

properties.comment: Default text on White and Light backgrounds. Excellent contrast ratio!
properties.name: colorText

properties.comment: Default background
properties.name: colorBackground

properties.comment: Border for default button.
properties.name: colorUi50

properties.comment: Subtle border, disabled button background
properties.name: colorUi30

properties.comment: Disabled buttons, regular subtle border.
properties.name: colorUi20

properties.comment: Default subdued divider between sections on a white background.
properties.name: colorDivider

properties.comment: Disabled buttons, regular subtle border.
properties.name: colorUi00

properties.comment: Light text. Lowest contrast ratio in navy on ui10.
properties.name: colorTextLightOnDark

properties.comment: Not used yet, just an example
properties.name: colorBrand01Dark

properties.comment: And so on... larger spaces are possible but would be less and less common.
properties.name: spacingXLarge

properties.comment: Used for grid margin and gutters, and other things.
properties.name: spacingLarge

properties.comment: Normal spacing inside and outside a component
properties.name: spacingRegular

properties.comment: Normal spacing inside a component
properties.name: spacingSmall

properties.comment: Use sparingly.
properties.name: spacingTiny

properties.comment: button radius
properties.name: radiusRegular
